title: Flexible constructor bodies
summary: Validate and compute values before calling super() or this().
explanation: Java 25 lifts the restriction that super() must be the first statement. You can now validate arguments, compute derived values, and set up state before delegating to the parent constructor.

whyModernWins.title: Fail fast
whyModernWins.desc: Validate arguments before the superclass constructor runs.

whyModernWins.title: Compute first
whyModernWins.desc: Derive values and prepare data before calling super().

whyModernWins.title: No workarounds
whyModernWins.desc: No more static helper methods or factory patterns to work around the restriction.
